metadata.title: Cumulative Security Update for Internet Explorer - CVE-2015-2444
metadata.description: Microsoft Internet Explorer 8 through 11 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via a crafted web site, aka "Memory Corruption Vulnerability," a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-2442.

criteria.comment: Check for installation of vulnerable IE + vulnerable Windows OS + vulnerable file version
IE7 is installed + Windows OS + file version

extend_definition.comment: Microsoft Internet Explorer 7 is installed

registry_object.comment: This registry key identifies the Windows CurrentBuild
registry_object.name: CurrentBuild

family_object.comment: This is the default family object. Only one family object should exist.

registry_object.comment: This registry key identifies the system root.
registry_object.name: SystemRoot

file_object.comment: Object holds the details of mshtml.dll file in the system root

registry_object.comment: This registry key identifies the version of internet Explorer
registry_object.name: Version

registry_object.comment: This registry key holds the service pack installed on the host if one is present.
registry_object.name: CSDVersion

registry_object.comment: This registry key identifies the architecture on the system
registry_object.name: PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE

registry_object.comment: This registry key identifies the Windows ProductName
registry_object.name: ProductName

registry_object.comment: This registry key holds the BuildLab
registry_object.name: BuildLab

registry_object.comment: Object holds the version of IE 10 or IE 11
registry_object.name: svcVersion
